children.subject:
" If you still have questions on which class is best, and/or if you decide to take EECS 47D, please email Prof. Elad Alon for guidance."

Please clarify to him that you are not a new student

To answer this explicitly on this forum, no, EECS 47D can not be used along with Math 54 to fulfill the lower division requirements.  For those who fall in to the category that was mentioned (i.e., you have a good handle on the linear algebra covered in math 54), I would very strongly recommend on planning to take 16B.  (Whether you take 47D before that or simply self-study the appropriate circuits material from 16A is however totally up to you.)

If I take the second route -

"Students who completed Math 54 and went through the linear algebra portions of the EE 16A homeworks with no significant difficulty should self-study circuits and/or take EECS 47D, then take EE 16B."

- can I just take EECS 47D to fulfill the EE requirment for CS majors graduating in 2018?
please email Prof. Elad Alon he will give you more information
How can we enroll in EECS 47D? Also, how many units is it?

no

"If your first term was before Fall 2017, see your lower-division requirements here: 

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-lowerdiv"

For L&S CS majors admitted to Berkeley before Fall 2017, can we use EECS 47D to fulfill the requirements for EE 16A?

[Sorry for asking this, I think this question may have been answered, but I just want to clarify]
See the first paragraph in the post.
Hi, I'm trying to enroll in EECS47D but I'm getting an error message saying that I need appproval in order to enroll? Am I supposed to use a permission number to add the class?

This is not a path that we recommend - if you're already enrolled in 16A, I'd suggest just dropping Math 54 (and then taking 16B next semester).  If you're not currently enrolled in 16A, please send me an email and we can discuss the specifics of your situation further and come up with an appropriate plan of action.
What if you are concurrently enrolled in Math 54?

history.content:
We're seeing questions from LSCS/CS-intended students on whether they should take EE16A or the EECS 47D bridge course in order to prepare for EE16B. Please use the guidelines below. If you still have questions on which class is best, and/or if you decide to take EECS 47D, please email Prof. Elad Alon for guidance. EECS 47D is a variable-unit course so you need to speak with him in order to enroll.

  • Students who completed Math 54, have a good background in circuits or self-studied that material in advance, and reviewed the EE 16A homeworks with no significant difficulty completing them, should take EE 16B.

  • Students who completed Math 54 and went through the linear algebra portions of the EE 16A homeworks with no significant difficulty should self-study circuits and/or take EECS 47D, then take EE 16B.

  • All others (including students who completed Math 54, but don't feel comfortable enough with the material to do the EE 16A homeworks),  should take EE16A (or EECS 47D if there is a unit issue), then take EE 16B.

If your first term was before Fall 2017, see your lower-division requirements here: 

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-lowerdiv
history.subject: EE16A vs. EECS 47D guidelines for students entering Fall 2017
